By 2050, London could be using nearly 12 million kWh of electricity every day on electric buses, shared fleets, and private cars alone. That’s nearly a 300 percent increase in current electricity demand, or roughly about the same amount of energy you’d need to run 17,000 refrigerators for a year.

Los Angeles is the American city with the most polluted ozone in 2018. In LA County, around 15 percent of children have lifetime asthma, and LA gas prices are almost consistently above the national average.

Siemens predicts that by 2050, e-Mobility could reduce traffic-related GHG emissions by 74 percent and decrease traffic-related air pollution by 62 percent. With an increase of nearly 11 million kWh of electricity used per day, in a city like Mumbai you could binge watch 66 million hours of television with that much energy.
